alert.note: Alert for Gallia; Jackson; Lawrence; Vinton (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 17 at 11:08PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Greenup, Carter, Gallia, Jackson, south central Vinton, central Lawrence and northwestern Mason Counties through MIDNIGHT EDT... At 1108 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Jackson to 7 miles southwest of Vanceburg. Movement was southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Ashland, Portsmouth, Ironton, Jackson, Grayson, Gallipolis, Coal Grove, Olive Hill, Oak Hill, Rio Grande, Lake Vesuvius, Grayson Lake State Park, Carter Caves State Park, New Boston, Greenup, Gesling, Greenbo Lake, Oldtown, Load and Letitia. This includes Interstate 64 in Kentucky between mile markers 149 and 179. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 200 AM EDT for northeastern Kentucky...southeastern Ohio...and western West Virginia.
